faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals can purchase property in Spain with minimal restrictions. Most non-EU citizens require an NIE (Spanish tax identification number), which is straightforward to obtain. Our team can guide you through the legal requirements and help coordinate with local lawyers and financial advisors to ensure a smooth purchase process.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the property purchase price, typical costs include: property transfer tax (6-10%), notary and registration fees (approximately 1-2%), legal fees (typically 0.5-1%), and potential real estate agent commission (3-5%). These costs vary by autonomous community and specific circumstances. We recommend consulting with a local lawyer for accurate estimates for your particular situation.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: No, purchasing property in Spain does not require a visa. However, if you plan to reside in Spain, you may need to arrange appropriate residency status depending on your nationality and length of stay. EU/EEA citizens enjoy freedom of movement, while non-EU citizens should check current visa and residency requirements with Spanish immigration authorities.

faqs.question: How much are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Property taxes in Spain include annual wealth tax on properties valued over €600,000 (rates vary by region), and local property tax (IBI) typically ranging from 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value annually. Rental income is also subject to Spanish income tax. Our team can provide detailed tax information and recommend consultation with a Spanish accountant for comprehensive tax planning.
